Answer.154219: lol sorry for the long answer but that s actually very dangerous and should not be done for riding . in the event of an emergency the rider wouldn t be able to bail . for example if the horse were to somehow trip and fall down you d be crushed to death under their weight with no escape cause you couldn t get off . if they bolted off and started bucking like a bronco the rider wouldn t be able to sit up and prevent them from doing that by using their body as a counter balance . if one of the ties holding you to the saddle broke off and you partially fell down while the horse was in motion , you d be halfway tied to the saddle and dragged by the leg connected to the saddle with your body on the ground next to the horse s feet risking being trampled , kicked , knocked on the head , breaking your leg , ankle , etc by having it twisted while stuck to the saddle . i ve actually seen this happen to someone before and they had multiple injuries from it . broken ankle , torn knee tendon , broken ribs , concussion , and a whole bunch of cuts and bruising everywhere . overall it s just a super horrible idea . plus a lot of riding involves a form of basically standing up in the stirrups to properly balance and move with the horse . if you were tied to the saddle it would be super hard to do that and you d be flopping around really uncomfortably . i ve seen people with disabilities be strapped in the the saddle for hippotherapy sessions with people walking with the horse on both sides of them and with a person leading the horse with a rope in front because the rider is incapable of sitting up on their own , but never really seen someone strap a young child into a saddle actually . it s important for a beginner level person just learning to ride to hold their own selves up so they can be able to build up their muscles and be better balanced later in their riding journey

Answer.154370: unlike dogs who are mostly concerned about pleasing their owner in order to receive food and love and therefore a place in the pack , horses are only concerned with feeling like you can provide safety from predators and that you ll protect them as a good friend . food is pretty much everywhere for them , so your relationship has to be based more on trust and friendship rather than being the food and pets person . it s that fact that gives people the opportunity to learn about themselves in ways that lots of other animals can t help you with . in order to work with horses effectively , get them to do what you want , and be a good horseman , you need to be able to center yourself and control your emotions . horses can only react to stimulus that we give them . they don t understand anything else other than what we show them through our subtle body language and tone of voice . they re really really good at picking up the vibe somebody gives off and picking up on their mood . horses can help us realize what sort of vibes were putting out and how our actions , thoughts , and words affect others around us . they can help us learn to be more calm , confident , compassionate , and centered .
